Package com.googlecode.cqengine.query

Class QueryFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.query.QueryFactory
  • public class QueryFactory
extends Object
    A static factory for creating Query objects and its descendants.
    Author:
    Niall Gallagher

      • between

        public static <O,​A extends Comparable<A>> Between<O,​A> between​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute,
                                                                           A lowerValue,
                                                                           boolean lowerInclusive,
                                                                           A upperValue,
                                                                           boolean upperInclusive)
        Creates a Between query which asserts that an attribute is between a lower and an upper bound.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        lowerValue - The lower bound to be asserted by the query
        lowerInclusive - Whether the lower bound is inclusive or not (true for "greater than or equal to")
        upperValue - The upper bound to be asserted by the query
        upperInclusive - Whether the upper bound is inclusive or not (true for "less than or equal to")
        Returns:
        A GreaterThan query

      • in

        public static <O,​A> Query<O> in​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute,
                                      A... attributeValues)

        Creates a In query which asserts that an attribute has at least one value matching any value in a set of values.

        If the given attribute is a SimpleAttribute, this method will set a hint in the query to indicate that results for the child queries will inherently be disjoint and so will not require deduplication.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        attributeValues - The set of values to match
        Returns:
        An In query

      • in

        public static <O,​A> Query<O> in​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute,
                                      Collection<A> attributeValues)

        Creates a In query which asserts that an attribute has at least one value matching any value in a set of values.

        If the given attribute is a SimpleAttribute, this method will set a hint in the query to indicate that results for the child queries will inherently be disjoint and so will not require deduplication.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        attributeValues - TThe set of values to match
        Returns:
        An In query

      • in

        public static <O,​A> Query<O> in​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute,
                                      boolean disjoint,
                                      Collection<A> attributeValues)

        Creates a In query which asserts that an attribute has at least one value matching any value in a set of values.

        Note that this can result in more efficient queries than several Equal queries "OR"ed together using other means.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        disjoint - Set it to true if deduplication is not necessary because the results are disjoint. Set it to false deduplication is needed
        attributeValues - The set of values to match
        Returns:
        An In query

      • matchesRegex

        public static <O,​A extends CharSequence> StringMatchesRegex<O,​A> matchesRegex​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute,
                                                                                          Pattern regexPattern)
        Creates a StringMatchesRegex query which asserts that an attribute's value matches a regular expression.

        To accelerate matchesRegex(...) queries, add a Standing Query Index on matchesRegex(...).

      • has

        public static <O,​A> Has<O,​A> has​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute)
        Creates an Has query which asserts that an attribute has a value (is not null).

        To accelerate has(...) queries, add a Standing Query Index on has(...).

        To assert that an attribute does not have a value (is null), use not(has(...)).

        To accelerate not(has(...)) queries, add a Standing Query Index on not(has(...)).

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the attribute
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute to which the query refers
        Returns:
        An Has query

      • and

        public static <O> And<O> and​(Query<O> query1,
                             Query<O> query2)
        Creates an And query, representing a logical AND on child queries, which when evaluated yields the set intersection of the result sets from child queries.
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing attributes to which child queries refer
        Parameters:
        query1 - The first child query to be connected via a logical AND
        query2 - The second child query to be connected via a logical AND
        Returns:
        An And query, representing a logical AND on child queries

      • existsIn

        public static <O,​F,​A> Query<O> existsIn​(IndexedCollection<F> foreignCollection,
                                                    Attribute<O,​A> localKeyAttribute,
                                                    Attribute<F,​A> foreignKeyAttribute)
        Creates a query supporting the equivalent of SQL EXISTS.

        Asserts that objects in a local IndexedCollection match objects in a foreign collection, based on a key attribute of local objects being equal to a key attribute of the foreign objects. This query can be performed on the local collection, supplying the foreign collection and the relevant attributes, as arguments to the query.

        This supports the SQL equivalent of:

         SELECT * From LocalCollection
 WHERE EXISTS (
     SELECT * FROM ForeignCollection
     WHERE LocalCollection.localAttribute = ForeignCollection.foreignAttribute
 )
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the local object
        F - The type of the foreign objects
        A - The type of the common attributes
        Parameters:
        foreignCollection - The collection of foreign objects
        localKeyAttribute - An attribute of the local object
        foreignKeyAttribute - An attribute of objects in the foreign collection
        Returns:
        A query which checks if the local object matches any objects in the foreign collection based on the given key attributes being equal

      • existsIn

        public static <O,​F,​A> Query<O> existsIn​(IndexedCollection<F> foreignCollection,
                                                    Attribute<O,​A> localKeyAttribute,
                                                    Attribute<F,​A> foreignKeyAttribute,
                                                    Query<F> foreignRestrictions)
        Creates a query supporting the equivalent of SQL EXISTS, with some additional restrictions on foreign objects.

        Asserts that objects in a local IndexedCollection match objects in a foreign collection, based on a key attribute of local objects being equal to a key attribute of the foreign objects, AND objects in the foreign collection matching some additional criteria. This query can be performed on the local collection, supplying the foreign collection and the relevant attributes, as arguments to the query.

        This supports the SQL equivalent of:

         SELECT * From LocalCollection
 WHERE EXISTS (
     SELECT * FROM ForeignCollection
     WHERE LocalCollection.localAttribute = ForeignCollection.foreignAttribute
         AND ([AND|OR|NOT](ForeignCollection.someOtherAttribute = x) ...)
 )
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the local object
        F - The type of the foreign objects
        A - The type of the common attributes
        Parameters:
        foreignCollection - The collection of foreign objects
        localKeyAttribute - An attribute of the local object
        foreignKeyAttribute - An attribute of objects in the foreign collection
        foreignRestrictions - A query specifying additional restrictions on foreign objects
        Returns:
        A query which checks if the local object matches any objects in the foreign collection based on the given key attributes being equal

      • all

        public static <O> Query<O> all​(Class<O> objectType)
        Creates a query which matches all objects in the collection.

        This is equivalent to a literal boolean 'true'.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the objects in the collection
        Returns:
        A query which matches all objects in the collection

      • none

        public static <O> Query<O> none​(Class<O> objectType)
        Creates a query which matches no objects in the collection.

        This is equivalent to a literal boolean 'false'.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the objects in the collection
        Returns:
        A query which matches no objects in the collection

      • ascending

        public static <O> AttributeOrder<O> ascending​(Attribute<O,​? extends Comparable> attribute)
        Creates an AttributeOrder object which pairs an attribute with a preference to sort results by that attribute in ascending order. These AttributeOrder objects can then be passed to the orderBy(com.googlecode.cqengine.query.option.AttributeOrder[]) method to create a query option which sorts results by the indicated attributes and ascending/descending preferences.
        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attributes
        Parameters:
        attribute - An attribute to sort by
        Returns:
        An AttributeOrder object, encapsulating the attribute and a preference to sort results by it in ascending order

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attributes
        Parameters:
        attribute - An attribute to sort by
        Returns:
        An AttributeOrder object, encapsulating the attribute and a preference to sort results by it in descending order

      • enableFlags

        public static FlagsEnabled enableFlags​(Object... flags)
        Creates a FlagsEnabled object which may be added to query options. This object encapsulates arbitrary "flag" objects which are said to be "enabled".

        Some components such as indexes allow their default behaviour to be overridden by setting flags in this way.

        Parameters:
        flags - Arbitrary objects which represent flags which may be interpreted by indexes etc.
        Returns:
        A populated FlagsEnabled object which may be added to query options

      • disableFlags

        Some components such as indexes allow their default behaviour to be overridden by setting flags in this way.

        Parameters:
        flags - Arbitrary objects which represent flags which may be interpreted by indexes etc.
        Returns:
        A populated FlagsDisabled object which may be added to query options

        Returns:

      • mapEntity

        public static Map mapEntity​(Map map)
        Wraps the given Map in a MapEntity, which can improve its performance when used in an IndexedCollection. If the given Map already is a MapEntity, the same object will be returned.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to wrap
        Returns:
        a MapEntity wrapping the given map

      • primaryKeyedMapEntity

        public static Map primaryKeyedMapEntity​(Map map,
                                        Object primaryKey)
        Wraps the given Map in a PrimaryKeyedMapEntity, which can improve its performance when used in an IndexedCollection. If the given Map already is a PrimaryKeyedMapEntity, the same object will be returned.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to wrap
        primaryKey - The key of the entry in the map to be used as a primary key
        Returns:
        a PrimaryKeyedMapEntity wrapping the given map

      • missingLast

        public static <O> OrderMissingLastAttribute<O> missingLast​(Attribute<O,​? extends Comparable> delegateAttribute)
        Returns an OrderMissingLastAttribute which which can be used in an orderBy(AttributeOrder) clause to specify that objects which do not have values for the given delegate attribute should be returned after objects which do have values for the attribute.

        Essentially, this attribute can be used to order results based on whether a has(Attribute) query on the delegate attribute would return true or false. See documentation in OrderMissingLastAttribute for more details.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        delegateAttribute - The attribute which may or may not return values, based on which results should be ordered
        Returns:
        An OrderMissingLastAttribute which orders objects with values before those without values

      • missingFirst

        public static <O> OrderMissingFirstAttribute<O> missingFirst​(Attribute<O,​? extends Comparable> delegateAttribute)
        Returns an OrderMissingFirstAttribute which which can be used in an orderBy(AttributeOrder) clause to specify that objects which do not have values for the given delegate attribute should be returned before objects which do have values for the attribute.

        Essentially, this attribute can be used to order results based on whether a has(Attribute) query on the delegate attribute would return true or false. See documentation in OrderMissingFirstAttribute for more details.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        Parameters:
        delegateAttribute - The attribute which may or may not return values, based on which results should be ordered
        Returns:
        An OrderMissingFirstAttribute which orders objects without values before those with values

      • forStandingQuery

        public static <O> StandingQueryAttribute<O> forStandingQuery​(Query<O> standingQuery)
        Creates a StandingQueryAttribute based on the given query. An index can then be built on this attribute, and it will be able to to answer the query in constant time complexity O(1).
        Parameters:
        standingQuery - The standing query to encapsulate
        Returns:
        a StandingQueryAttribute encapsulating the given query

      • forObjectsMissing

        public static <O,​A> StandingQueryAttribute<O> forObjectsMissing​(Attribute<O,​A> attribute)
        Creates a StandingQueryAttribute which returns true if the given attribute does not have values for an object.

        An index can then be built on this attribute, and it will be able to to answer a not(has(attribute)) query, returning objects which do not have values for that attribute, in constant time complexity O(1).

        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute which will be used in a not(has(attribute)) query
        Returns:
        a StandingQueryAttribute which returns true if the given attribute does not have values for an object

      • attribute

        public static <O,​A> SimpleAttribute<O,​A> attribute​(SimpleFunction<O,​A> function)
        Creates a SimpleAttribute from the given function or lambda expression, while attempting to infer generic type information for the attribute automatically.

        Limitations of type inference
        As of Java 8, there are limitations of this type inference. CQEngine uses TypeTools to infer generic types. See documentation of that library for details. If generic type information cannot be inferred, as a workaround you may use the overloaded variant of this method which allows the types to be specified explicitly.

        This is a convenience method, which delegates to attribute(String, SimpleFunction), supplying function.getClass().getName() as the name of the attribute.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        A - The type of the attribute
        Parameters:
        function - A function or lambda expression
        Returns:
        A SimpleAttribute created from the given function or lambda expression

      • attribute

        public static <O,​A,​I extends Iterable<A>> MultiValueNullableAttribute<O,​A> nullableAttribute​(Class<A> attributeType,
                                                                                                               MultiValueFunction<O,​A,​I> function)
        Creates a MultiValueNullableAttribute from the given function or lambda expression, while attempting to infer generic type information for the attribute automatically.

        Limitations of type inference
        As of Java 8, there are limitations of this type inference. CQEngine uses TypeTools to infer generic types. See documentation of that library for details. If generic type information cannot be inferred, as a workaround you may use the overloaded variant of this method which allows the types to be specified explicitly.

        This is a convenience method, which delegates to nullableAttribute(Class, String, MultiValueFunction), supplying function.getClass().getName() as the name of the attribute.

        Type Parameters:
        O - The type of the object containing the attribute
        A - The type of the attribute
        Parameters:
        attributeType - The type of the attribute
        function - A function or lambda expression
        Returns:
        A MultiValueNullableAttribute created from the given function or lambda expression

      • nullableAttribute

        public static <O,​A,​I extends Iterable<A>> MultiValueNullableAttribute<O,​A> nullableAttribute​(Class<A> attributeType,
                                                                                                               String attributeName,
                                                                                                               MultiValueFunction<O,​A,​I> function)

                                                                                                               MultiValueFunction<O,​A,​I> function)

      • predicate

        public static <O> Predicate<O> predicate​(Query<O> query)
        Converts a Query to a Predicate which can evaluate if the the query matches any given object. The predicate will determine this by invoking Query.matches(Object, QueryOptions), supplying null for the query options.

        Note that while most queries do not utilize query options and thus will be compatible with this method, it's possible that some queries might require query options. For those cases, create the predicate via the counterpart method predicate(Query, QueryOptions) instead.

        Parameters:
        query - The query to be converted to a predicate
        Returns:
        A predicate which can evaluate if the the query matches any given object

      • predicate

        public static <O> Predicate<O> predicate​(Query<O> query,
                                         QueryOptions queryOptions)
        Converts a Query to a Predicate which can evaluate if the the query matches any given object. The predicate will determine this by invoking Query.matches(Object, QueryOptions).
        Parameters:
        query - The query to be converted to a predicate
        queryOptions - The query options to supply to the Query.matches(Object, QueryOptions) method
        Returns:
        A predicate which can evaluate if the the query matches any given object
